content.raw:
+1

Though I still think it should be set to False at the beginning of the function and not the end, otherwise any piece of code changing this variable after init and before this function is called will cause this to use random data.

Quick note: this variable has no utility outside this function so it should be a local variable (in the function's scope), this would allow you to not allocate memory for it for the entire lifetime of the class' instance and prevent unexpected effect like the one I mentioned above
content.html:
+1

Though I still think it should be set to False at the beginning of the function and not the end, otherwise any piece of code changing this variable after init and before this function is called will cause this to use random data.

Quick note: this variable has no utility outside this function so it should be a local variable (in the function's scope), this would allow you to not allocate memory for it for the entire lifetime of the class' instance and prevent unexpected effect like the one I mentioned above
